newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen B shares end lower, awaiting results.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen B shares end lower, awaiting results.

text.p: Shenzhen's B share index ended down on Friday, with investors reducing positions ahead of the flood of companies 1996 annual results, brokers said.
The B share index edged down 0.04 points or 0.02 percent to 155.48 points on turnover of HK$88.79 million, compared with Thursday's HK$52.34 million.
"Investors are cautious with the approach of the weekend," said one broker. "Besides, many companies have yet to publish their annual results."
Of 43 firms with B shares listed in Shenzhen, only Fangda has issued its 1996 annual report, a spokesman for the Shenzhen Stock Exchange said.
Only 38 of China's 530 listed firms have issued their 1996 results with half of the reporting season already passed and the April 30 deadline approaching, Shanghai Securities News said on Friday.
"Wary sentiment will extend into next week," an analyst said.
Diesel engine maker Changchai Co was the biggest loser, falling HK$0.18 or 2.34 percent to HK$7.50 on volume of 441,500 shares.

Zhuhai Special Economic Zone Lizhu Pharmaceutical, aided by overseas buying, rose HK$0.30 to HK$5.52 on heaviest trade of 1.83 million shares, brokers said, adding they expected the company to post solid 1996 profit.

China Marine Containers was the second most active counter with 1.76 million shares changing hands. It gained HK$0.04 to HK$9.04 on talk of the firm's plan for an attractive bonus issue based on 1996 profits.

The A share index dipped 0.76 points or 0.19 percent to 395.32 on volume of 7.14 billion yuan on heavy profit-taking in a range of counters that appeared overvalued after recent sharp rises, brokers said.
Xinjiang Huitong, which is mainly involved in hydraulic engineering, performed worst and lost 0.80 yuan to 20.19 yuan on trade of 564,700 shares.
